messages.content:
Here are some of the latest changes in the Artificial Intelligence industry:

1. **The Top AI Trends** (IBM): Adapting to emerging AI trends is essential for maximizing potential and responsibly scaling generative AI adoption. [Read more](https://www.ibm.com/think/insights/artificial-intelligence-trends)

2. **The Future of AI** (Built In): AI is expanding its role in daily life, from household tasks to enhancing workplace efficiency through generative models. [Read more](https://builtin.com/artificial-intelligence/artificial-intelligence-future)

3. **AI Market Growth Statistics**: The global AI market is expected to increase in value by around 5x over the next 5 years, reaching approximately $391 billion. [Read more](https://explodingtopics.com/blog/ai-statistics)

4. **AI News and Insights**: Explore the latest AI news, including breakthroughs and trends in regulation and ethics. [Read more](https://www.artificialintelligence-news.com/)

5. **Five Trends in AI and Data Science for 2025**: Insights from AI experts on the trends leaders should watch. [Read more](https://sloanreview.mit.edu/article/five-trends-in-ai-and-data-science-for-2025/)

For a comprehensive view, explore reports such as the [State of AI Report 2025](https://www.stateof.ai/) and the [AI Index](https://aiindex.stanford.edu/report/).
There are so many video content regarding article intelligence I have an interest to learn about AI in my native language Telugu.

reasoning: To find educational videos about artificial intelligence in Telugu, I will search YouTube for relevant content using the language specification.

    "JobResult(title='Senior principal / developer', company_name='Oracle', location='Montpelier, VT', via='Institute Of Data Jobs', description=\"Job Description\\n\\nSenior Principal AI Developer\\n\\nLocation: United States (REMOTE)\\n\\nAbout the Role:\\n\\nWe're looking for highly experienced AI Developers to join our team and help shape the future of AI at Oracle. In this role, you'll lead the design and development of advanced AI applications, particularly those powered by large language models (LLMs) and help integrate them across Oracle's Fusion ecosystem. You'll work on cutting-edge problems, set engineering best practices, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver secure, scalable, and responsible AI solutions.\\n\\nWe encourage applicants from all backgrounds and experiences to apply - if you're passionate about AI and meet most of the qualifications, we want to hear from you.\\n\\nWhat You'll Do:\\n\\nLLM Application Engineering\\n\u2022 Architect and implement scalable applications using LLMs, focusing on prompt engineering, model customization, and performance optimization.\\n\u2022 Design and orchestrate agent-based solutions (e.g., using LangGraph or similar), including task decomposition, tool invocation, and setting up guardrails for safe operations.\\n\u2022 Develop effective RAG (retrieval-augmented generation) pipelines with robust chunking, embedding model selection, and vector store optimization.\\n\u2022 Structure and refine prompts, manage tool/function calling, and evaluate when to use general vs. fine-tuned models based on trade-offs like accuracy, latency, and cost.\\n\u2022 Build secure, scalable integrations with enterprise systems, using NL2SQL patterns and API connectivity.\\n\\nAI/ML Engineering\\n\u2022 Design, train, and optimize machine learning models for practical, real-world use cases.\\n\u2022 Build end-to-end ML pipelines: data ingestion, feature engineering, model training, validation, and deployment.\\n\u2022 Work closely with data engineers and developers to embed ML into production systems.\\n\u2022 Monitor model performance and retrain as needed to maintain quality and relevance.\\n\\nLLMOps & Platform Engineering\\n\u2022 Manage versioning for prompts, models, and pipelines; run controlled experiments (A/B tests) and deployments.\\n\u2022 Implement observability for agent workflows, including tracing, logging, retries, and fallback mechanisms.\\n\\nData Engineering & Feature Development\\n\u2022 Lead data acquisition, transformation, and feature engineering efforts to support reliable training and inference.\\n\u2022 Ensure clear schema definitions, metadata tracking, and lineage management.\\n\\nEvaluation, Quality, and Safety\\n\u2022 Define and maintain rigorous evaluation processes (e.g., precision/recall, hallucination detection, business alignment).\\n\u2022 Implement and enforce Responsible AI practices, including privacy protection, access controls, and secure data handling.\\n\\nConversational UX & Fusion Integration\\n\u2022 Set standards for conversational UX, including multi-turn dialogues and natural language interfaces.\\n\u2022 Design AI components that integrate seamlessly into Oracle Fusion applications, promoting automation and user-centric workflows.\\n\\nThought Leadership & Collaboration\\n\u2022 Mentor and support teammates; advocate for best practices in AI/ML development.\\n\u2022 Collaborate in agile pods and influence architectural and strategic decisions across teams.\\n\u2022 Evaluate emerging AI technologies and run proof-of-concept experiments to drive innovation\\n\\nWhat We're Looking For:\\n\u2022 Experience: 10+ years in software/AI development, with 3+ years focused on LLMs or related deep learning systems.\\n\u2022 Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python (and/or Java), cloud-based data pipelines, and MLOps tools (e.g., OCI Data Science, MLflow, Kubeflow).\\n\u2022 LLM Expertise: Hands-on experience with models such as OpenAI, Anthropic, or open-source LLMs; familiarity with prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and deployment strategies.\\n\u2022 Cloud & Enterprise Experience: Experience integrating AI into enterprise cloud ecosystems. Oracle Cloud/Fusion experience is a strong plus.\\n\u2022 NLP & Conversational AI: Deep understanding of NLP, conversational systems, and dialog design.\\n\u2022 Responsible AI: Proven ability to design AI systems with safety, fairness, and governance in mind.\\n\u2022 Collaboration: Excellent communication and mentorship skills; thrives in cross-functional, diverse teams.\\n\\nWhy Join Us?\\n\u2022 Shape the future of AI at Oracle and influence global-scale business applications.\\n\u2022 Work with a talented, inclusive, and innovative team on impactful AI projects.\\n\u2022 Contribute to solutions that are immediately deployed across Oracle's AI offerings.\\n\u2022 Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely or from a hub, with a focus on work-life balance.\\n\u2022 Tackle diverse and complex challenges with the support of world-class engineers and scientists.\\n\\nDisclaimer:\\n\\nCertain US customer or client-facing roles may be required to comply with applicable requirements, such as immunization and occupational health mandates.\\n\\nRange and benefit information provided in this posting are specific to the stated locations only\\n\\nUS: Hiring Range in USD from: $96,800 to $251,600 per annum. May be eligible for bonus, equity, and compensation deferral.\\n\\nOracle maintains broad salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions and locations, as well as reflect Oracle's differing products, industries and lines of business.\\n\\nCandidates are typically placed into the range based on the preceding factors as well as internal peer equity.\\n\\nOracle US offers a comprehensive benefits package which includes the following:\\n\\nMedical, dental, and vision insurance, including expert medical opinion\\n\\nShort term disability and long term disability\\n\\nLife insurance and AD&D\\n\\nSupplemental life insurance (Employee/Spouse/Child)\\n\\nHealth care and dependent care Flexible Spending Accounts\\n\\nPre-tax commuter and parking benefits\\n\\n401(k) Savings and Investment Plan with company match\\n\\nPaid time off: Flexible Vacation is provided to all eligible employees assigned to a salaried (non-overtime eligible) position. Accrued Vacation is provided to all other employees eligible for vacation benefits. For employees working at least 35 hours per week, the vacation accrual rate is 13 days annually for the first three years of employment and 18 days annually for subsequent years of employment. Vacation accrual is prorated for employees working between 20 and 34 hours per week. Employees working fewer than 20 hours per week are not eligible for vacation.\\n\\n11 paid holidays\\n\\nPaid sick leave: 72 hours of paid sick leave upon date of hire. Refreshes each calendar year. Unused balance will carry over each year up to a maximum cap of 112 hours.\\n\\nPaid parental leave\\n\\nAdoption assistance\\n\\nEmployee Stock Purchase Plan\\n\\nFinancial planning and group legal\\n\\nVoluntary benefits including auto, homeowner and pet insurance\\n\\nThe role will generally accept applications for at least three calendar days from the posting date or as long as the job remains posted.\\n\\nCareer Level - IC5\\n\\nAbout Us\\n\\nAs a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow's technology to tackle today's challenges. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have \u2014 whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.\\n\\nUnconditional Inclusion\\n\\nWe are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness.     "JobResult(title='AI Prompt & Agent Developer', company_name='Opencall.ai', location='Anywhere', via='Y Combinator', description='AI Prompt & Agent Developer\\n\\nLocation: On-site (San Francisco or New York)\\n\\nAbout Opencall\\n\\nAt Opencall, we\u2019re building AI call centers for non-technical businesses.\\n\\nWe\u2019re solving a unique challenge: pushing the limits of AI at millisecond performance to have the best human-like customer service experience at enterprise scale. Our AI is faster, cheaper, more powerful, and more reliable than anything else on the market. We\u2019re looking for versatile engineers to help scale our proprietary system from millions of calls to billions of calls annually.\\n\\nWe\u2019re looking for an AI Prompt & Agent Developer to help us design, test, and scale next-generation AI agents that deliver measurable impact for our customers. You\u2019ll work at the intersection of LLMs, software engineering, and customer operations, building systems that directly shape how companies interact with their customers.\\n\\nResponsibilities\\n\\nPrompt Engineering & QA:\\n\u2022 Design, build, and refine prompts for real-world agent tasks (Q&A, classification, lead qualification, appointment booking, knowledge lookup).\\n\u2022 Develop robust evaluation pipelines to measure accuracy, reliability, compliance, and business outcomes of AI prompts at scale.\\n\\nAI Agent Development:\\n\u2022 Architect and implement multi-step AI agents that integrate with telephony (Twilio, SIP), CRMs, and customer systems.\\n\u2022 Ensure agents are reliable, scalable, and cost-optimized in high-volume environments.\\n\\nTesting & Continuous Improvement:\\n\u2022 Lead QA workflows for AI agents, simulating real-world customer scenarios and measuring outcomes.\\n\u2022 Monitor production agent performance and iterate rapidly to improve.\\n\\nCross-Functional Collaboration:\\n\u2022 Work closely with product, ops, and engineering to design features driven by business needs.\\n\u2022 Partner with sales and customer success teams to translate client requirements into effective agent behavior.\\n\\nRequirements\\n\u2022 2+ years of experience with AI/ML, NLP, or prompt engineering.\\n\u2022 Demonstrated experience building and deploying AI prompts and/or agents in production.\\n\u2022 Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset;     "JobResult(title='Senior principal / developer', company_name='Oracle', location='Montpelier, VT', via='Institute Of Data Jobs', description=\"Job Description\\n\\nSenior Principal AI Developer\\n\\nLocation: United States (REMOTE)\\n\\nAbout the Role:\\n\\nWe're looking for highly experienced AI Developers to join our team and help shape the future of AI at Oracle. In this role, you'll lead the design and development of advanced AI applications, particularly those powered by large language models (LLMs) and help integrate them across Oracle's Fusion ecosystem. You'll work on cutting-edge problems, set engineering best practices, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver secure, scalable, and responsible AI solutions.\\n\\nWe encourage applicants from all backgrounds and experiences to apply - if you're passionate about AI and meet most of the qualifications, we want to hear from you.\\n\\nWhat You'll Do:\\n\\nLLM Application Engineering\\n\u2022 Architect and implement scalable applications using LLMs, focusing on prompt engineering, model customization, and performance optimization.\\n\u2022 Design and orchestrate agent-based solutions (e.g., using LangGraph or similar), including task decomposition, tool invocation, and setting up guardrails for safe operations.\\n\u2022 Develop effective RAG (retrieval-augmented generation) pipelines with robust chunking, embedding model selection, and vector store optimization.\\n\u2022 Structure and refine prompts, manage tool/function calling, and evaluate when to use general vs. fine-tuned models based on trade-offs like accuracy, latency, and cost.\\n\u2022 Build secure, scalable integrations with enterprise systems, using NL2SQL patterns and API connectivity.\\n\\nAI/ML Engineering\\n\u2022 Design, train, and optimize machine learning models for practical, real-world use cases.\\n\u2022 Build end-to-end ML pipelines: data ingestion, feature engineering, model training, validation, and deployment.\\n\u2022 Work closely with data engineers and developers to embed ML into production systems.\\n\u2022 Monitor model performance and retrain as needed to maintain quality and relevance.\\n\\nLLMOps & Platform Engineering\\n\u2022 Manage versioning for prompts, models, and pipelines; run controlled experiments (A/B tests) and deployments.\\n\u2022 Implement observability for agent workflows, including tracing, logging, retries, and fallback mechanisms.\\n\\nData Engineering & Feature Development\\n\u2022 Lead data acquisition, transformation, and feature engineering efforts to support reliable training and inference.\\n\u2022 Ensure clear schema definitions, metadata tracking, and lineage management.\\n\\nEvaluation, Quality, and Safety\\n\u2022 Define and maintain rigorous evaluation processes (e.g., precision/recall, hallucination detection, business alignment).\\n\u2022 Implement and enforce Responsible AI practices, including privacy protection, access controls, and secure data handling.\\n\\nConversational UX & Fusion Integration\\n\u2022 Set standards for conversational UX, including multi-turn dialogues and natural language interfaces.\\n\u2022 Design AI components that integrate seamlessly into Oracle Fusion applications, promoting automation and user-centric workflows.\\n\\nThought Leadership & Collaboration\\n\u2022 Mentor and support teammates; advocate for best practices in AI/ML development.\\n\u2022 Collaborate in agile pods and influence architectural and strategic decisions across teams.\\n\u2022 Evaluate emerging AI technologies and run proof-of-concept experiments to drive innovation\\n\\nWhat We're Looking For:\\n\u2022 Experience: 10+ years in software/AI development, with 3+ years focused on LLMs or related deep learning systems.\\n\u2022 Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python (and/or Java), cloud-based data pipelines, and MLOps tools (e.g., OCI Data Science, MLflow, Kubeflow).\\n\u2022 LLM Expertise: Hands-on experience with models such as OpenAI, Anthropic, or open-source LLMs; familiarity with prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and deployment strategies.\\n\u2022 Cloud & Enterprise Experience: Experience integrating AI into enterprise cloud ecosystems. Oracle Cloud/Fusion experience is a strong plus.\\n\u2022 NLP & Conversational AI: Deep understanding of NLP, conversational systems, and dialog design.\\n\u2022 Responsible AI: Proven ability to design AI systems with safety, fairness, and governance in mind.\\n\u2022 Collaboration: Excellent communication and mentorship skills; thrives in cross-functional, diverse teams.\\n\\nWhy Join Us?\\n\u2022 Shape the future of AI at Oracle and influence global-scale business applications.\\n\u2022 Work with a talented, inclusive, and innovative team on impactful AI projects.\\n\u2022 Contribute to solutions that are immediately deployed across Oracle's AI offerings.\\n\u2022 Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely or from a hub, with a focus on work-life balance.\\n\u2022 Tackle diverse and complex challenges with the support of world-class engineers and scientists.\\n\\nDisclaimer:\\n\\nCertain US customer or client-facing roles may be required to comply with applicable requirements, such as immunization and occupational health mandates.\\n\\nRange and benefit information provided in this posting are specific to the stated locations only\\n\\nUS: Hiring Range in USD from: $96,800 to $251,600 per annum. May be eligible for bonus, equity, and compensation deferral.\\n\\nOracle maintains broad salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions and locations, as well as reflect Oracle's differing products, industries and lines of business.\\n\\nCandidates are typically placed into the range based on the preceding factors as well as internal peer equity.\\n\\nOracle US offers a comprehensive benefits package which includes the following:\\n\\nMedical, dental, and vision insurance, including expert medical opinion\\n\\nShort term disability and long term disability\\n\\nLife insurance and AD&D\\n\\nSupplemental life insurance (Employee/Spouse/Child)\\n\\nHealth care and dependent care Flexible Spending Accounts\\n\\nPre-tax commuter and parking benefits\\n\\n401(k) Savings and Investment Plan with company match\\n\\nPaid time off: Flexible Vacation is provided to all eligible employees assigned to a salaried (non-overtime eligible) position. Accrued Vacation is provided to all other employees eligible for vacation benefits. For employees working at least 35 hours per week, the vacation accrual rate is 13 days annually for the first three years of employment and 18 days annually for subsequent years of employment.     "JobResult(title='Quantitative Developer -  AI Implementation', company_name='WorldQuant', location='New York, NY (+7 others)', via='Built In San Francisco', description=\"WorldQuant develops and deploys systematic financial strategies across a broad range of asset classes and global markets. We seek to produce high-quality predictive signals (alphas) through our proprietary research platform to employ financial strategies focused on market inefficiencies. Our teams work collaboratively to drive the production of alphas and financial strategies \u2013 the foundation of a balanced, global investment platform.\\n\\nWorldQuant is built on a culture that pairs academic sensibility with accountability for results. Employees are encouraged to challenge conventional thinking and possess an attitude of continuous improvement.\\n\\nOur goal is to hire the best and the brightest. We value intellectual horsepower first and foremost, and people who demonstrate an outstanding talent. There is no roadmap to future success, so we need people who can help us build it.\\n\u2022 *Project Overview:**\\n\\nThis is a cutting-edge initiative to integrate Large Language Models (LLMs) with WorldQuant's proprietary strategy management tools. The project aims to provide AI-assisted insights, automate routine analytical tasks, and enable natural language interactions for Portfolio Managers to more efficiently analyze, maintain, and enhance their trading strategies. This involves building foundational infrastructure, developing robust data pipelines for metrics and features, and creating a secure, user-centric interface with a strong focus on protecting intellectual property.\\n\u2022 *Role Summary:**\\n\\nWe are seeking a talented and motivated Full-Time Software Engineer to play a key role in the development and enhancement of this AI-driven platform. You will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining critical components of the system, primarily focusing on the Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers that form the backbone of the platform. This includes enhancing existing MCPs, such as our proprietary command-line interface for strategy data, developing new MCPs for internal data system integration, strategy analysis, and performance metrics, and contributing to the secure and effective use of LLMs.\\n\u2022 *Key Responsibilities:**\\n\u2022 Design, develop, test, and deploy robust and scalable MCP servers and related tools in engineering techniques to interact with LLMs, ensuring effective information retrieval while minimizing the risk of intellectual property leakage.**\\n\u2022 Collaborate with project managers, technical leads, and other developers to define technical specifications and integrate various data sources.\\n\u2022 Work on API development and integration, ensuring seamless data flow between different systems (internal knowledge management systems, simulation systems, data warehouses).\\n\u2022 Implement data parsing and manipulation logic for various formats (JSON, CSV).\\n\u2022 Contribute to the design and implementation of data pipelines for strategy metrics and features.\\n\u2022 Address and resolve bugs and issues in existing MCP tools and infrastructure.\\n\u2022 technologies and methodologies in AI, LLMs, prompt engineering, and financial technology.\\n\u2022 *Qualifications:**\\n\u2022 **Core Skills:**\\n\u2022 Strong proficiency in Python Models.**\\n\u2022 **Awareness of data security and intellectual property protection considerations in the context of AI and LLM applications.**\\n\u2022 **Domain-Specific Knowledge (Highly Beneficial):**\\n\u2022 Familiarity with financial data (e.g., PnL, Sharpe ratio, alpha, risk factors, AUM).\\n\u2022 Experience with quantitative trading systems, market data systems, or strategy     "JobResult(title='AI Prompt & Agent Developer', company_name='Opencall.ai', location='Anywhere', via='Y Combinator', description='AI Prompt & Agent Developer\\n\\nLocation: On-site (San Francisco or New York)\\n\\nAbout Opencall\\n\\nAt Opencall, we\u2019re building AI call centers for non-technical businesses.\\n\\nWe\u2019re solving a unique challenge: pushing the limits of AI at millisecond performance to have the best human-like customer service experience at enterprise scale. Our AI is faster, cheaper, more powerful, and more reliable than anything else on the market. We\u2019re looking for versatile engineers to help scale our proprietary system from millions of calls to billions of calls annually.\\n\\nWe\u2019re looking for an AI Prompt & Agent Developer to help us design, test, and scale next-generation AI agents that deliver measurable impact for our customers. You\u2019ll work at the intersection of LLMs, software engineering, and customer operations, building systems that directly shape how companies interact with their customers.\\n\\nResponsibilities\\n\\nPrompt Engineering & QA:\\n\u2022 Design, build, and refine prompts for real-world agent tasks (Q&A, classification, lead qualification, appointment booking, knowledge lookup).\\n\u2022 Develop robust evaluation pipelines to measure accuracy, reliability, compliance, and business outcomes of AI prompts at scale.\\n\\nAI Agent Development:\\n\u2022 Architect and implement multi-step AI agents that integrate with telephony (Twilio, SIP), CRMs, and customer systems.\\n\u2022 Ensure agents are reliable, scalable, and cost-optimized in high-volume environments.\\n\\nTesting & Continuous Improvement:\\n\u2022 Lead QA workflows for AI agents, simulating real-world customer scenarios and measuring outcomes.\\n\u2022 Monitor production agent performance and iterate rapidly to improve.\\n\\nCross-Functional Collaboration:\\n\u2022 Work closely with product, ops, and engineering to design features driven by business needs.\\n\u2022 Partner with sales and customer success teams to translate client requirements into effective agent behavior.\\n\\nRequirements\\n\u2022 2+ years of experience with AI/ML, NLP, or prompt engineering.\\n\u2022 Demonstrated experience building and deploying AI prompts and/or agents in production.\\n\u2022 Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset; comfort with ambiguity.\\n\u2022 Excellent written and verbal communication skills.\\n\u2022 Bachelor\u2019s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or related field.\\n\\nPreferred Qualifications\\n\u2022 Strong programming skills in Python (experience with APIs, data pipelines, testing frameworks).\\n\u2022 Hands-on experience with multiple LLMs (GPT, Claude, LLaMA, Gemini, Mistral, or fine-tuned models).\\n\u2022 Familiarity with telephony platforms (e.g., Twilio) or conversational AI systems.\\n\u2022 Prior exposure to contact center, SaaS, or customer-facing technology.\\n\u2022 Master\u2019s or PhD in a technical discipline is a plus.\\n\\nFAQ\\n\\nWhat motivates us?\\n\u2022 We hate bad customer service and the \u201cpress 1, press 2\u201d headache.     "JobResult(title='Senior principal / developer', company_name='Oracle', location='Montpelier, VT', via='Institute Of Data Jobs', description=\"Job Description\\n\\nSenior Principal AI Developer\\n\\nLocation: United States (REMOTE)\\n\\nAbout the Role:\\n\\nWe're looking for highly experienced AI Developers to join our team and help shape the future of AI at Oracle. In this role, you'll lead the design and development of advanced AI applications, particularly those powered by large language models (LLMs) and help integrate them across Oracle's Fusion ecosystem. You'll work on cutting-edge problems, set engineering best practices, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver secure, scalable, and responsible AI solutions.\\n\\nWe encourage applicants from all backgrounds and experiences to apply - if you're passionate about AI and meet most of the qualifications, we want to hear from you.\\n\\nWhat You'll Do:\\n\\nLLM Application Engineering\\n\u2022 Architect and implement scalable applications using LLMs, focusing on prompt engineering, model customization, and performance optimization.\\n\u2022 Design and orchestrate agent-based solutions (e.g., using LangGraph or similar), including task decomposition, tool invocation, and setting up guardrails for safe operations.\\n\u2022 Develop effective RAG (retrieval-augmented generation) pipelines with robust chunking, embedding model selection, and vector store optimization.\\n\u2022 Structure and refine prompts, manage tool/function calling, and evaluate when to use general vs. fine-tuned models based on trade-offs like accuracy, latency, and cost.\\n\u2022 Build secure, scalable integrations with enterprise systems, using NL2SQL patterns and API connectivity.\\n\\nAI/ML Engineering\\n\u2022 Design, train, and optimize machine learning models for practical, real-world use cases.\\n\u2022 Build end-to-end ML pipelines: data ingestion, feature engineering, model training, validation, and deployment.\\n\u2022 Work closely with data engineers and developers to embed ML into production systems.\\n\u2022 Monitor model performance and retrain as needed to maintain quality and relevance.\\n\\nLLMOps & Platform Engineering\\n\u2022 Manage versioning for prompts, models, and pipelines; run controlled experiments (A/B tests) and deployments.\\n\u2022 Implement observability for agent workflows, including tracing, logging, retries, and fallback mechanisms.\\n\\nData Engineering & Feature Development\\n\u2022 Lead data acquisition, transformation, and feature engineering efforts to support reliable training and inference.\\n\u2022 Ensure clear schema definitions, metadata tracking, and lineage management.\\n\\nEvaluation, Quality, and Safety\\n\u2022 Define and maintain rigorous evaluation processes (e.g., precision/recall, hallucination detection, business alignment).\\n\u2022 Implement and enforce Responsible AI practices, including privacy protection, access controls, and secure data handling.\\n\\nConversational UX & Fusion Integration\\n\u2022 Set standards for conversational UX, including multi-turn dialogues and natural language interfaces.\\n\u2022 Design AI components that integrate seamlessly into Oracle Fusion applications, promoting automation and user-centric workflows.\\n\\nThought Leadership & Collaboration\\n\u2022 Mentor and support teammates; advocate for best practices in AI/ML development.\\n\u2022 Collaborate in agile pods and influence architectural and strategic decisions across teams.\\n\u2022 Evaluate emerging AI technologies and run proof-of-concept experiments to drive innovation\\n\\nWhat We're Looking For:\\n\u2022 Experience: 10+ years in software/AI development, with 3+ years focused on LLMs or related deep learning systems.\\n\u2022 Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python (and/or Java), cloud-based data pipelines, and MLOps tools (e.g., OCI Data Science, MLflow, Kubeflow).\\n\u2022 LLM Expertise: Hands-on experience with models such as OpenAI, Anthropic, or open-source LLMs; familiarity with prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and deployment strategies.\\n\u2022 Cloud & Enterprise Experience: Experience integrating AI into enterprise cloud ecosystems. Oracle Cloud/Fusion experience is a strong plus.\\n\u2022 NLP & Conversational AI: Deep understanding of NLP, conversational systems, and dialog design.\\n\u2022 Responsible AI: Proven ability to design AI systems with safety, fairness, and governance in mind.\\n\u2022 Collaboration: Excellent communication and mentorship skills; thrives in cross-functional, diverse teams.\\n\\nWhy Join Us?\\n\u2022 Shape the future of AI at Oracle and influence global-scale business applications.\\n\u2022 Work with a talented, inclusive, and innovative team on impactful AI projects.\\n\u2022 Contribute to solutions that are immediately deployed across Oracle's AI offerings.\\n\u2022 Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely or from a hub, with a focus on work-life balance.\\n\u2022 Tackle diverse and complex challenges with the support of world-class engineers and scientists.\\n\\nDisclaimer:\\n\\nCertain US customer or client-facing roles may be required to comply with applicable requirements, such as immunization and occupational health mandates.\\n\\nRange and benefit information provided in this posting are specific to the stated locations only\\n\\nUS: Hiring Range in USD from: $96,800 to $251,600 per annum. May be eligible for bonus, equity, and compensation deferral.\\n\\nOracle maintains broad salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions and locations, as well as reflect Oracle's differing products, industries and lines of business.\\n\\nCandidates are typically placed into the range based on the preceding factors as well as internal peer equity.\\n\\nOracle US offers a comprehensive benefits package which includes the following:\\n\\nMedical, dental, and vision insurance, including expert medical opinion\\n\\nShort term disability and long term disability\\n\\nLife insurance and AD&D\\n\\nSupplemental life insurance (Employee/Spouse/Child)\\n\\nHealth care and dependent care Flexible Spending Accounts\\n\\nPre-tax commuter and parking benefits\\n\\n401(k) Savings and Investment Plan with company match\\n\\nPaid time off: Flexible Vacation is provided to all eligible employees assigned to a salaried (non-overtime eligible) position. Accrued Vacation is provided to all other employees eligible for vacation benefits. For employees working at least 35 hours per week, the vacation accrual rate is 13 days annually for the first three years of employment and 18 days annually for subsequent years of employment. Vacation accrual is prorated for employees working between 20 and 34 hours per week. Employees working fewer than 20 hours per week are not eligible for vacation.\\n\\n11 paid holidays\\n\\nPaid sick leave: 72 hours of paid sick leave upon date of hire. Refreshes each calendar year. Unused balance will carry over each year up to a maximum cap of 112 hours.\\n\\nPaid parental leave\\n\\nAdoption assistance\\n\\nEmployee Stock Purchase Plan\\n\\nFinancial planning and group legal\\n\\nVoluntary benefits including auto, homeowner and pet insurance\\n\\nThe role will generally accept applications for at least three calendar days from the posting date or as long as the job remains posted.\\n\\nCareer Level - IC5\\n\\nAbout Us\\n\\nAs a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow's technology to tackle today's challenges. We've partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector-and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.\\n\\nWe know that true innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute.     "JobResult(title='AI Prompt & Agent Developer', company_name='Opencall.ai', location='Anywhere', via='Y Combinator', description='AI Prompt & Agent Developer\\n\\nLocation: On-site (San Francisco or New York)\\n\\nAbout Opencall\\n\\nAt Opencall, we\u2019re building AI call centers for non-technical businesses.\\n\\nWe\u2019re solving a unique challenge: pushing the limits of AI at millisecond performance to have the best human-like customer service experience at enterprise scale. Our AI is faster, cheaper, more powerful, and more reliable than anything else on the market. We\u2019re looking for versatile engineers to help scale our proprietary system from millions of calls to billions of calls annually.\\n\\nWe\u2019re looking for an AI Prompt & Agent Developer to help us design, test, and scale next-generation AI agents that deliver measurable impact for our customers. You\u2019ll work at the intersection of LLMs, software engineering, and customer operations, building systems that directly shape how companies interact with their customers.\\n\\nResponsibilities\\n\\nPrompt Engineering & QA:\\n\u2022 Design, build, and refine prompts for real-world agent tasks (Q&A, classification, lead qualification, appointment booking, knowledge lookup).\\n\u2022 Develop robust evaluation pipelines to measure accuracy, reliability, compliance, and business outcomes of AI prompts at scale.\\n\\nAI Agent Development:\\n\u2022 Architect and implement multi-step AI agents that integrate with telephony (Twilio, SIP), CRMs, and customer systems.\\n\u2022 Ensure agents are reliable, scalable, and cost-optimized in high-volume environments.\\n\\nTesting & Continuous Improvement:\\n\u2022 Lead QA workflows for AI agents, simulating real-world customer scenarios and measuring outcomes.\\n\u2022 Monitor production agent performance and iterate rapidly to improve.\\n\\nCross-Functional Collaboration:\\n\u2022 Work closely with product, ops, and engineering to design features driven by business needs.\\n\u2022 Partner with sales and customer success teams to translate client requirements into effective agent behavior.\\n\\nRequirements\\n\u2022 2+ years of experience with AI/ML, NLP, or prompt engineering.\\n\u2022 Demonstrated experience building and deploying AI prompts and/or agents in production.\\n\u2022 Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset; comfort with ambiguity.\\n\u2022 Excellent written and verbal communication skills.\\n\u2022 Bachelor\u2019s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or related field.\\n\\nPreferred Qualifications\\n\u2022 Strong programming skills in Python (experience with APIs, data pipelines, testing frameworks).\\n\u2022 Hands-on experience with multiple LLMs (GPT, Claude, LLaMA, Gemini, Mistral, or fine-tuned models).\\n\u2022 Familiarity with telephony platforms (e.g., Twilio) or conversational AI systems.\\n\u2022 Prior exposure to contact center, SaaS, or customer-facing technology.\\n\u2022 Master\u2019s or PhD in a technical discipline is a plus.\\n\\nFAQ\\n\\nWhat motivates us?\\n\u2022 We hate bad customer service and the \u201cpress 1, press 2\u201d headache.     "JobResult(title='Principal Full-Stack AI Engineer', company_name='AT&T Mobility Services LLC', location='Middletown Township, NJ', via='ZipRecruiter', description=\"Job Description:\\n\\nThis position requires office presence of a minimum of 5 days per week and is only located in the location(s) posted. In this role, you will focus on architecting scalable, reliable backend services and integrating advanced AI agents using Python and frameworks like LangGraph and MCP (Model Context Protocol). You will work closely with multidisciplinary teams to deliver intelligent, context-aware solutions that power real-world applications.\\n\\nWhat You'll Bring:\\n\u2022 Backend System Development:\\nArchitect, implement, and maintain scalable backend services and APIs using Python (FastAPI, Flask, Django) to support AI agent operations.\\n\u2022 AI Agent & MCP orchestration.\\n\u2022 Agent Orchestration & Workflow:\\nUtilize frameworks like LangGraph and MCP to design, compose, and manage complex agent workflows, multi-agent coordination, and state management.\\n\u2022 System Integration:\\nIntegrate external data sources, third-party APIs, vector databases, and machine learning models to enhance agent capabilities.\\n\u2022 Performance & Reliability:\\nOptimize system performance, ensure high availability, and implement robust logging, monitoring, and error-handling solutions.\\n\u2022 Collaboration:\\nWork cross-functionally with front-end developers, data scientists, and product teams to translate requirements into technical designs and deliverables.\\n\u2022 Security & Compliance:\\nImplement best practices for data security, privacy, and compliance in all backend operations.\\n\\nWhat You'll Need:\\n\u2022 Strong experience with backend Python frameworks (FastAPI, Flask, Django), RESTful API design, and database management (SQL/NoSQL).\\n\u2022 Proven expertise in integrating and orchestrating AI agents, LLMs, or multi-agent systems in production environments.\\n\u2022 Hands-on experience with MCP (Model Context Protocol) for coordinating and managing AI models and agent workflows.\\n\u2022 Familiarity with agent workflow orchestration tools such as LangGraph.\\n\u2022 Experience with containerization (Docker), CI/CD pipelines, and cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, Azure).\\n\u2022 Knowledge of vector databases, data pipelines, and scalable distributed systems.\\n\u2022 Proven experience designing, optimizing, and maintaining PostgreSQL or other relational databases, including schema design, performance tuning, and advanced query development.\\n\u2022 Excellent problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and communication skills.\\n\\nPreferred:\\n\u2022 Background in designing backend architectures for AI or data-intensive applications.\\n\u2022 Experience with knowledge graphs, RAG pipelines, or advanced agent coordination.\\n\u2022 Open-source contributions or experience with modern agent/LLM frameworks, MCP, or similar platforms.\\n\\nOur Principal Software Engineer earns     "JobResult(title='Senior principal / developer', company_name='Oracle', location='Montpelier, VT', via='Institute Of Data Jobs', description=\"Job Description\\n\\nSenior Principal AI Developer\\n\\nLocation: United States (REMOTE)\\n\\nAbout the Role:\\n\\nWe're looking for highly experienced AI Developers to join our team and help shape the future of AI at Oracle. In this role, you'll lead the design and development of advanced AI applications, particularly those powered by large language models (LLMs) and help integrate them across Oracle's Fusion ecosystem. You'll work on cutting-edge problems, set engineering best practices, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver secure, scalable, and responsible AI solutions.\\n\\nWe encourage applicants from all backgrounds and experiences to apply - if you're passionate about AI and meet most of the qualifications, we want to hear from you.\\n\\nWhat You'll Do:\\n\\nLLM Application Engineering\\n\u2022 Architect and implement scalable applications using LLMs, focusing on prompt engineering, model customization, and performance optimization.\\n\u2022 Design and orchestrate agent-based solutions (e.g., using LangGraph or similar), including task decomposition, tool invocation, and setting up guardrails for safe operations.\\n\u2022 Develop effective RAG (retrieval-augmented generation) pipelines with robust chunking, embedding model selection, and vector store optimization.\\n\u2022 Structure and refine prompts, manage tool/function calling, and evaluate when to use general vs. fine-tuned models based on trade-offs like accuracy, latency, and cost.\\n\u2022 Build secure, scalable integrations with enterprise systems, using NL2SQL patterns and API connectivity.\\n\\nAI/ML Engineering\\n\u2022 Design, train, and optimize machine learning models for practical, real-world use cases.\\n\u2022 Build end-to-end ML pipelines: data ingestion, feature engineering, model training, validation, and deployment.\\n\u2022 Work closely with data engineers and developers to embed ML into production systems.\\n\u2022 Monitor model performance and retrain as needed to maintain quality and relevance.\\n\\nLLMOps & Platform Engineering\\n\u2022 Manage versioning for prompts, models, and pipelines; run controlled experiments (A/B tests) and deployments.\\n\u2022 Implement observability for agent workflows, including tracing, logging, retries, and fallback mechanisms.\\n\\nData Engineering & Feature Development\\n\u2022 Lead data acquisition, transformation, and feature engineering efforts to support reliable training and inference.\\n\u2022 Ensure clear schema definitions, metadata tracking, and lineage management.\\n\\nEvaluation, Quality, and Safety\\n\u2022 Define and maintain rigorous evaluation processes (e.g., precision/recall, hallucination detection, business alignment).\\n\u2022 Implement and enforce Responsible AI practices, including privacy protection, access controls, and secure data handling.\\n\\nConversational UX & Fusion Integration\\n\u2022 Set standards for conversational UX, including multi-turn dialogues and natural language interfaces.\\n\u2022 Design AI components that integrate seamlessly into Oracle Fusion applications, promoting automation and user-centric workflows.\\n\\nThought Leadership & Collaboration\\n\u2022 Mentor and support teammates; advocate for best practices in AI/ML development.\\n\u2022 Collaborate in agile pods and influence architectural and strategic decisions across teams.\\n\u2022 Evaluate emerging AI technologies and run proof-of-concept experiments to drive innovation\\n\\nWhat We're Looking For:\\n\u2022 Experience: 10+ years in software/AI development, with 3+ years focused on LLMs or related deep learning systems.\\n\u2022 Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python (and/or Java), cloud-based data pipelines, and MLOps tools (e.g., OCI Data Science, MLflow, Kubeflow).\\n\u2022 LLM Expertise: Hands-on experience with models such as OpenAI, Anthropic, or open-source LLMs; familiarity with prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and deployment strategies.\\n\u2022 Cloud & Enterprise Experience: Experience integrating AI into enterprise cloud ecosystems. Oracle Cloud/Fusion experience is a strong plus.\\n\u2022 NLP & Conversational AI: Deep understanding of NLP, conversational systems, and dialog design.\\n\u2022 Responsible AI: Proven ability to design AI systems with safety, fairness, and governance in mind.\\n\u2022 Collaboration: Excellent communication and mentorship skills; thrives in cross-functional, diverse teams.\\n\\nWhy Join Us?\\n\u2022 Shape the future of AI at Oracle and influence global-scale business applications.\\n\u2022 Work with a talented, inclusive, and innovative team on impactful AI projects.\\n\u2022 Contribute to solutions that are immediately deployed across Oracle's AI offerings.\\n\u2022 Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely or from a hub, with a focus on work-life balance.\\n\u2022 Tackle diverse and complex challenges with the support of world-class engineers and scientists.\\n\\nDisclaimer:\\n\\nCertain US customer or client-facing roles may be required to comply with applicable requirements, such as immunization and occupational health mandates.\\n\\nRange and benefit information provided in this posting are specific to the stated locations only\\n\\nUS: Hiring Range in USD from: $96,800 to $251,600 per annum. May be eligible for bonus, equity, and compensation deferral.\\n\\nOracle maintains broad salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions and locations, as well as reflect Oracle's differing products, industries and lines of business.\\n\\nCandidates are typically placed into the range based on the preceding factors as well as internal peer equity.\\n\\nOracle US offers a comprehensive benefits package which includes the following:\\n\\nMedical, dental, and vision insurance, including expert medical opinion\\n\\nShort term disability and long term disability\\n\\nLife insurance and AD&D\\n\\nSupplemental life insurance (Employee/Spouse/Child)\\n\\nHealth care and dependent care Flexible Spending Accounts\\n\\nPre-tax commuter and parking benefits\\n\\n401(k) Savings and Investment Plan with company match\\n\\nPaid time off: Flexible Vacation is provided to all eligible employees assigned to a salaried (non-overtime eligible) position. Accrued Vacation is provided to all other employees eligible for vacation benefits. For employees working at least 35 hours per week, the vacation accrual rate is 13 days annually for the first three years of employment and 18 days annually for subsequent years of employment. Vacation accrual is prorated for employees working between 20 and 34 hours per week. Employees working fewer than 20 hours per week are not eligible for vacation.\\n\\n11 paid holidays\\n\\nPaid sick leave: 72 hours of paid sick leave upon date of hire. Refreshes each calendar year. Unused balance will carry over each year up to a maximum cap of 112 hours.\\n\\nPaid parental leave\\n\\nAdoption assistance\\n\\nEmployee Stock Purchase Plan\\n\\nFinancial planning and group legal\\n\\nVoluntary benefits including auto, homeowner and pet insurance\\n\\nThe role will generally accept applications for at least three calendar days from the posting date or as long as the job remains posted.\\n\\nCareer Level - IC5\\n\\nAbout Us\\n\\nAs a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow's technology to tackle today's challenges. We've partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector-and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.\\n\\nWe know that true innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute.     "JobResult(title='Quantitative Developer -  AI Implementation', company_name='WorldQuant', location='New York, NY (+7 others)', via='Built In San Francisco', description=\"WorldQuant develops and deploys systematic financial strategies across a broad range of asset classes and global markets. We seek to produce high-quality predictive signals (alphas) through our proprietary research platform to employ financial strategies focused on market inefficiencies. Our teams work collaboratively to drive the production of alphas and financial strategies \u2013 the foundation of a balanced, global investment platform.\\n\\nWorldQuant is built on a culture that pairs academic sensibility with accountability for results. metrics, and contributing to the secure and effective use of LLMs.\\n\u2022 *Key Responsibilities:**\\n\u2022 Design, develop, test, and deploy robust and scalable MCP servers and related tools in technical leads, and other developers to define technical specifications and integrate various data sources.\\n\u2022 Work on API development and integration, ensuring seamless data flow between different systems (internal knowledge management systems, simulation systems, data warehouses).\\n\u2022 Implement data parsing and manipulation logic for various formats (JSON, CSV).\\n\u2022 Contribute to the design and implementation of data pipelines for strategy metrics and features.\\n\u2022 Address and resolve bugs and issues in existing MCP tools and infrastructure.\\n\u2022 technologies and methodologies in AI, LLMs, prompt engineering, and financial technology.\\n\u2022 *Qualifications:**\\n\u2022 **Core Skills:**\\n\u2022 Strong proficiency in Python Experience with data parsing and manipulation libraries and techniques (e.g., pandas, JSON, CSV).\\n\u2022 **Understanding of or experience with prompt engineering principles for Large Language Models.**\\n\u2022 **Awareness of data security and intellectual property protection considerations in the context of AI and LLM applications.**\\n\u2022 **Domain-Specific Knowledge (Highly Beneficial):**\\n\u2022 Familiarity with financial data (e.g., PnL, Sharpe ratio, alpha, risk factors, AUM).\\n\u2022 Experience with quantitative trading systems, market data systems, or strategy     "JobResult(title='AI Prompt & Agent Developer', company_name='Opencall.ai', location='Anywhere', via='Y Combinator', description='AI Prompt & Agent Developer\\n\\nLocation: On-site (San Francisco or New York)\\n\\nAbout Opencall\\n\\nAt Opencall, we\u2019re building AI call centers for non-technical businesses.\\n\\nWe\u2019re solving a unique challenge: pushing the limits of AI at millisecond performance to have the best human-like customer service experience at enterprise scale. Our AI is faster, cheaper, more powerful, and more reliable than anything else on the market. We\u2019re looking for versatile engineers to help scale our proprietary system from millions of calls to billions of calls annually.\\n\\nWe\u2019re looking for an AI Prompt & Agent Developer to help us design, test, and scale next-generation AI agents that deliver measurable impact for our customers. You\u2019ll work at the intersection of LLMs, software engineering, and customer operations, building systems that directly shape how companies interact with their customers.\\n\\nResponsibilities\\n\\nPrompt Engineering & QA:\\n\u2022 Design, build, and refine prompts for real-world agent tasks (Q&A, classification, lead qualification, appointment booking, knowledge lookup).\\n\u2022 Develop robust evaluation pipelines to measure accuracy, reliability, compliance, and business outcomes of AI prompts at scale.\\n\\nAI Agent Development:\\n\u2022 Architect and implement multi-step AI agents that integrate with telephony (Twilio, SIP), CRMs, and customer systems.\\n\u2022 Ensure agents are reliable, scalable, and cost-optimized in high-volume environments.\\n\\nTesting & Continuous Improvement:\\n\u2022 Lead QA workflows for AI agents, simulating real-world customer scenarios and measuring outcomes.\\n\u2022 Monitor production agent performance and iterate rapidly to improve.\\n\\nCross-Functional Collaboration:\\n\u2022 Work closely with product, ops, and engineering to design features driven by business needs.\\n\u2022 Partner with sales and customer success teams to translate client requirements into effective agent behavior.\\n\\nRequirements\\n\u2022 2+ years of experience with AI/ML, NLP, or prompt engineering.\\n\u2022 Demonstrated experience building and deploying AI prompts and/or agents in production.\\n\u2022 Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset; comfort with ambiguity.\\n\u2022 Excellent written and verbal communication skills.\\n\u2022 Bachelor\u2019s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or related field.\\n\\nPreferred Qualifications\\n\u2022 Strong programming skills in Python (experience with APIs, data pipelines, testing frameworks).\\n\u2022 Hands-on experience with multiple LLMs (GPT, Claude, LLaMA, Gemini, Mistral, or fine-tuned models).\\n\u2022 Familiarity with telephony platforms (e.g., Twilio) or conversational AI systems.\\n\u2022 Prior exposure to contact center, SaaS, or customer-facing technology.\\n\u2022 Master\u2019s or PhD in a technical discipline is a plus.\\n\\nFAQ\\n\\nWhat motivates us?\\n\u2022 We hate bad customer service and the \u201cpress 1, press 2\u201d headache. Let\u2019s get end customers what they want without the suffering.\\n\\nCompany outlook?\\n\u2022 We have more customers than we can handle.     "JobResult(title='Senior principal / developer', company_name='Oracle', location='Montpelier, VT', via='Institute Of Data Jobs', description=\"Job Description\\n\\nSenior Principal AI Developer\\n\\nLocation: United States (REMOTE)\\n\\nAbout the Role:\\n\\nWe're looking for highly experienced AI Developers to join our team and help shape the future of AI at Oracle. In this role, you'll lead the design and development of advanced AI applications, particularly those powered by large language models (LLMs) and help integrate them across Oracle's Fusion ecosystem. You'll work on cutting-edge problems, set engineering best practices, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver secure, scalable, and responsible AI solutions.\\n\\nWe encourage applicants from all backgrounds and experiences to apply - if you're passionate about AI and meet most of the qualifications, we want to hear from you.\\n\\nWhat You'll Do:\\n\\nLLM Application Engineering\\n\u2022 Architect and implement scalable applications using LLMs, focusing on prompt engineering, model customization, and performance optimization.\\n\u2022 Design and orchestrate agent-based solutions (e.g., using LangGraph or similar), including task decomposition, tool invocation, and setting up guardrails for safe operations.\\n\u2022 Develop effective RAG (retrieval-augmented generation) pipelines with robust chunking, embedding model selection, and vector store optimization.\\n\u2022 Structure and refine prompts, manage tool/function calling, and evaluate when to use general vs. fine-tuned models based on trade-offs like accuracy, latency, and cost.\\n\u2022 Build secure, scalable integrations with enterprise systems, using NL2SQL patterns and API connectivity.\\n\\nAI/ML Engineering\\n\u2022 Design, train, and optimize machine learning models for practical, real-world use cases.\\n\u2022 Build end-to-end ML pipelines: data ingestion, feature engineering, model training, validation, and deployment.\\n\u2022 Work closely with data engineers and developers to embed ML into production systems.\\n\u2022 Monitor model performance and retrain as needed to maintain quality and relevance.\\n\\nLLMOps & Platform Engineering\\n\u2022 Manage versioning for prompts, models, and pipelines; run controlled experiments (A/B tests) and deployments.\\n\u2022 Implement observability for agent workflows, including tracing, logging, retries, and fallback mechanisms.\\n\\nData Engineering & Feature Development\\n\u2022 Lead data acquisition, transformation, and feature engineering efforts to support reliable training and inference.\\n\u2022 Ensure clear schema definitions, metadata tracking, and lineage management.\\n\\nEvaluation, Quality, and Safety\\n\u2022 Define and maintain rigorous evaluation processes (e.g., precision/recall, hallucination detection, business alignment).\\n\u2022 Implement and enforce Responsible AI practices, including privacy protection, access controls, and secure data handling.\\n\\nConversational UX & Fusion Integration\\n\u2022 Set standards for conversational UX, including multi-turn dialogues and natural language interfaces.\\n\u2022 Design AI components that integrate seamlessly into Oracle Fusion applications, promoting automation and user-centric workflows.\\n\\nThought Leadership & Collaboration\\n\u2022 Mentor and support teammates; advocate for best practices in AI/ML development.\\n\u2022 Collaborate in agile pods and influence architectural and strategic decisions across teams.\\n\u2022 Evaluate emerging AI technologies and run proof-of-concept experiments to drive innovation\\n\\nWhat We're Looking For:\\n\u2022 Experience: 10+ years in software/AI development, with 3+ years focused on LLMs or related deep learning systems.\\n\u2022 Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python (and/or Java), cloud-based data pipelines, and MLOps tools (e.g., OCI Data Science, MLflow, Kubeflow).\\n\u2022 LLM Expertise: Hands-on experience with models such as OpenAI, Anthropic, or open-source LLMs; familiarity with prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and deployment strategies.\\n\u2022 Cloud & Enterprise Experience: Experience integrating AI into enterprise cloud ecosystems. Oracle Cloud/Fusion experience is a strong plus.\\n\u2022 NLP & Conversational AI: Deep understanding of NLP, conversational systems, and dialog design.\\n\u2022 Responsible AI: Proven ability to design AI systems with safety, fairness, and governance in mind.\\n\u2022 Collaboration: Excellent communication and mentorship skills; thrives in cross-functional, diverse teams.\\n\\nWhy Join Us?\\n\u2022 Shape the future of AI at Oracle and influence global-scale business applications.\\n\u2022 Work with a talented, inclusive, and innovative team on impactful AI projects.\\n\u2022 Contribute to solutions that are immediately deployed across Oracle's AI offerings.\\n\u2022 Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely or from a hub, with a focus on work-life balance.\\n\u2022 Tackle diverse and complex challenges with the support of world-class engineers and scientists.\\n\\nDisclaimer:\\n\\nCertain US customer or client-facing roles may be required to comply with applicable requirements, such as immunization and occupational health mandates.\\n\\nRange and benefit information provided in this posting are specific to the stated locations only\\n\\nUS: Hiring Range in USD from: $96,800 to $251,600 per annum. May be eligible for bonus, equity, and compensation deferral.\\n\\nOracle maintains broad salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions and locations, as well as reflect Oracle's differing products, industries and lines of business.\\n\\nCandidates are typically placed into the range based on the preceding factors as well as internal peer equity.\\n\\nOracle US offers a comprehensive benefits package which includes the following:\\n\\nMedical, dental, and vision insurance, including expert medical opinion\\n\\nShort term disability and long term disability\\n\\nLife insurance and AD&D\\n\\nSupplemental life insurance (Employee/Spouse/Child)\\n\\nHealth care and dependent care Flexible Spending Accounts\\n\\nPre-tax commuter and parking benefits\\n\\n401(k) Savings and Investment Plan with company match\\n\\nPaid time off: Flexible Vacation is provided to all eligible employees assigned to a salaried (non-overtime eligible) position. Accrued Vacation is provided to all other employees eligible for vacation benefits. For employees working at least 35 hours per week, the vacation accrual rate is 13 days annually for the first three years of employment and 18 days annually for subsequent years of employment. Vacation accrual is prorated for employees working between 20 and 34 hours per week. Employees working fewer than 20 hours per week are not eligible for vacation.\\n\\n11 paid holidays\\n\\nPaid sick leave: 72 hours of paid sick leave upon date of hire. Refreshes each calendar year. Unused balance will carry over each year up to a maximum cap of 112 hours.\\n\\nPaid parental leave\\n\\nAdoption assistance\\n\\nEmployee Stock Purchase Plan\\n\\nFinancial planning and group legal\\n\\nVoluntary benefits including auto, homeowner and pet insurance\\n\\nThe role will generally accept applications for at least three calendar days from the posting date or as long as the job remains posted.\\n\\nCareer Level - IC5\\n\\nAbout Us\\n\\nAs a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow's technology to tackle today's challenges. We've partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector-and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.\\n\\nWe know that true innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute. We offer competitive benefits based on parity and consistency and support our people with flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.\\n\\nWe're committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process.     "JobResult(title='Senior principal / developer', company_name='Oracle', location='Montpelier, VT', via='Institute Of Data Jobs', description=\"Job Description\\n\\nSenior Principal AI Developer\\n\\nLocation: United States (REMOTE)\\n\\nAbout the Role:\\n\\nWe're looking for highly experienced AI Developers to join our team and help shape the future of AI at Oracle. In this role, you'll lead the design and development of advanced AI applications, particularly those powered by large language models (LLMs) and help integrate them across Oracle's Fusion ecosystem. You'll work on cutting-edge problems, set engineering best practices, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver secure, scalable, and responsible AI solutions.\\n\\nWe encourage applicants from all backgrounds and experiences to apply - if you're passionate about AI and meet most of the qualifications, we want to hear from you.\\n\\nWhat You'll Do:\\n\\nLLM Application Engineering\\n\u2022 Architect and implement scalable applications using LLMs, focusing on prompt engineering, model customization, and performance optimization.\\n\u2022 Design and orchestrate agent-based solutions (e.g., using LangGraph or similar), including task decomposition, tool invocation, and setting up guardrails for safe operations.\\n\u2022 Develop effective RAG (retrieval-augmented generation) pipelines with robust chunking, embedding model selection, and vector store optimization.\\n\u2022 Structure and refine prompts, manage tool/function calling, and evaluate when to use general vs. fine-tuned models based on trade-offs like accuracy, latency, and cost.\\n\u2022 Build secure, scalable integrations with enterprise systems, using NL2SQL patterns and API connectivity.\\n\\nAI/ML Engineering\\n\u2022 Design, train, and optimize machine learning models for practical, real-world use cases.\\n\u2022 Build end-to-end ML pipelines: data ingestion, feature engineering, model training, validation, and deployment.\\n\u2022 Work closely with data engineers and developers to embed ML into production systems.\\n\u2022 Monitor model performance and retrain as needed to maintain quality and relevance.\\n\\nLLMOps & Platform Engineering\\n\u2022 Manage versioning for prompts, models, and pipelines; run controlled experiments (A/B tests) and deployments.\\n\u2022 Implement observability for agent workflows, including tracing, logging, retries, and fallback mechanisms.\\n\\nData Engineering & Feature Development\\n\u2022 Lead data acquisition, transformation, and feature engineering efforts to support reliable training and inference.\\n\u2022 Ensure clear schema definitions, metadata tracking, and lineage management.\\n\\nEvaluation, Quality, and Safety\\n\u2022 Define and maintain rigorous evaluation processes (e.g., precision/recall, hallucination detection, business alignment).\\n\u2022 Implement and enforce Responsible AI practices, including privacy protection, access controls, and secure data handling.\\n\\nConversational UX & Fusion Integration\\n\u2022 Set standards for conversational UX, including multi-turn dialogues and natural language interfaces.\\n\u2022 Design AI components that integrate seamlessly into Oracle Fusion applications, promoting automation and user-centric workflows.\\n\\nThought Leadership & Collaboration\\n\u2022 Mentor and support teammates; advocate for best practices in AI/ML development.\\n\u2022 Collaborate in agile pods and influence architectural and strategic decisions across teams.\\n\u2022 Evaluate emerging AI technologies and run proof-of-concept experiments to drive innovation\\n\\nWhat We're Looking For:\\n\u2022 Experience: 10+ years in software/AI development, with 3+ years focused on LLMs or related deep learning systems.\\n\u2022 Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python (and/or Java), cloud-based data pipelines, and MLOps tools (e.g., OCI Data Science, MLflow, Kubeflow).\\n\u2022 LLM Expertise: Hands-on experience with models such as OpenAI, Anthropic, or open-source LLMs; familiarity with prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and deployment strategies.\\n\u2022 Cloud & Enterprise Experience: Experience integrating AI into enterprise cloud ecosystems. Oracle Cloud/Fusion experience is a strong plus.\\n\u2022 NLP & Conversational AI: Deep understanding of NLP, conversational systems, and dialog design.\\n\u2022 Responsible AI: Proven ability to design AI systems with safety, fairness, and governance in mind.\\n\u2022 Collaboration: Excellent communication and mentorship skills; thrives in cross-functional, diverse teams.\\n\\nWhy Join Us?\\n\u2022 Shape the future of AI at Oracle and influence global-scale business applications.\\n\u2022 Work with a talented, inclusive, and innovative team on impactful AI projects.\\n\u2022 Contribute to solutions that are immediately deployed across Oracle's AI offerings.\\n\u2022 Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely or from a hub, with a focus on work-life balance.\\n\u2022 Tackle diverse and complex challenges with the support of world-class engineers and scientists.\\n\\nDisclaimer:\\n\\nCertain US customer or client-facing roles may be required to comply with applicable requirements, such as immunization and occupational health mandates.\\n\\nRange and benefit information provided in this posting are specific to the stated locations only\\n\\nUS: Hiring Range in USD from: $96,800 to $251,600 per annum. May be eligible for bonus, equity, and compensation deferral.\\n\\nOracle maintains broad salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions and locations, as well as reflect Oracle's differing products, industries and lines of business.\\n\\nCandidates are typically placed into the range based on the preceding factors as well as internal peer equity.\\n\\nOracle US offers a comprehensive benefits package which includes the following:\\n\\nMedical, dental, and vision insurance, including expert medical opinion\\n\\nShort term disability and long term disability\\n\\nLife insurance and AD&D\\n\\nSupplemental life insurance (Employee/Spouse/Child)\\n\\nHealth care and dependent care Flexible Spending Accounts\\n\\nPre-tax commuter and parking benefits\\n\\n401(k) Savings and Investment Plan with company match\\n\\nPaid time off: Flexible Vacation is provided to all eligible employees assigned to a salaried (non-overtime eligible) position. Accrued Vacation is provided to all other employees eligible for vacation benefits. For employees working at least 35 hours per week, the vacation accrual rate is 13 days annually for the first three years of employment and 18 days annually for subsequent years of employment. Vacation accrual is prorated for employees working between 20 and 34 hours per week. Employees working fewer than 20 hours per week are not eligible for vacation.\\n\\n11 paid holidays\\n\\nPaid sick leave: 72 hours of paid sick leave upon date of hire. Refreshes each calendar year. Unused balance will carry over each year up to a maximum cap of 112 hours.\\n\\nPaid parental leave\\n\\nAdoption assistance\\n\\nEmployee Stock Purchase Plan\\n\\nFinancial planning and group legal\\n\\nVoluntary benefits including auto, homeowner and pet insurance\\n\\nThe role will generally accept applications for at least three calendar days from the posting date or as long as the job remains posted.\\n\\nCareer Level - IC5\\n\\nAbout Us\\n\\nAs a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow's technology to tackle today's challenges.     "JobResult(title='Quantitative Developer -  AI Implementation', company_name='WorldQuant', location='New York, NY (+7 others)', via='Built In San Francisco', description=\"WorldQuant develops and deploys systematic financial strategies across a broad range of asset classes and global markets. We seek to produce high-quality predictive signals (alphas) through our proprietary research platform to employ financial strategies focused on market inefficiencies. Our teams work collaboratively to drive the production of alphas and financial strategies \u2013 the foundation of a balanced, global investment platform.\\n\\nWorldQuant is built on a culture that pairs academic sensibility with accountability for results. metrics, and contributing to the secure and effective use of LLMs.\\n\u2022 *Key Responsibilities:**\\n\u2022 Design, develop, test, and deploy robust and scalable MCP servers and related tools in technical leads, and other developers to define technical specifications and integrate various data sources.\\n\u2022 Work on API development and integration, ensuring seamless data flow between different systems (internal knowledge management systems, simulation systems, data warehouses).\\n\u2022 Implement data parsing and manipulation logic for various formats (JSON, CSV).\\n\u2022 Contribute to the design and implementation of data pipelines for strategy metrics and features.\\n\u2022 Address and resolve bugs and issues in existing MCP tools and infrastructure.\\n\u2022 technologies and methodologies in AI, LLMs, prompt engineering, and financial technology.\\n\u2022 *Qualifications:**\\n\u2022 **Core Skills:**\\n\u2022 Strong proficiency in Python Experience with data parsing and manipulation libraries and techniques (e.g., pandas, JSON, CSV).\\n\u2022 **Understanding of or experience with prompt engineering principles for Large Language Models.**\\n\u2022 **Awareness of data security and intellectual property protection considerations in the context of AI and LLM applications.**\\n\u2022 **Domain-Specific Knowledge (Highly Beneficial):**\\n\u2022 Familiarity with financial data (e.g., PnL, Sharpe ratio, alpha, risk factors, AUM).\\n\u2022 Experience with quantitative trading systems, market data systems, or strategy
